snippet: The proposal indicates the magnitude of the task in the case against Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who is accused of planting the bombs that killed three people at the marathon.
abstract: Prosecution and defense in the trial over the Boston Marathon bombings have agreed to an elaborate process by which a jury may be selected to hear the case against defendant Dzhokhar Tsarnaev; agreement calls for the court to issue 2,000 summonses to potential jurors who will be given a questionnaire written jointly by the prosecution and the defense; proposal indicates magnitude of task in case against Tsarnaev.
lead_paragraph: The proposal indicates the magnitude of the task in the case against Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who is accused of planting the bombs that killed three people at the marathon.

headline.main: Accord Calls for Jury Pool of 2,000 in Boston Bombing Trial
headline.print_headline: Jury Pool of 2,000 for Trial in Boston
